name: Historical Brussels Free Walking Tour (Available in Spanish)
description:
Come with us to discover the charms and magic of one of the most important cities in Europe. Know and be surprised by its sites full of art and history, and discover why Brussels is considered the Heart of Belgium! We begin our tour in the Great Square, listed as Unesco's heritage, we will also visit: -Wall painting of the Tintín Quepis Courthouse, -Sablon Neighborhood, and the Notre Dame Du Sablon church -Royal Court Neighborhood -Brussels Palace -Artes Mountain -And many more places

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Mont des Arts
Royal Gallery of Saint Hubert
Grand-Place
Centre Belge de la Bande Dessinée
Église Sainte-Catherine de Bruxelles
Jeanneke Pis
Brussels FreeTour: a humans version of the city.  (Available in English)
shortDescription:
Ready to travel back in time? Present and past are one!

We'll start our visit at the Grand Place, the theatre of the history of the West. Victor Hugo considered it the most beautiful in the world!

Then guess what...it melts in your mouth and not in your hands when you start you can't stop eating...Yes, chocolate! We'll go on to taste some of the best chocolate shops.

Afterward we continue to the "huge" Mannaken Pis, the symbol of the city.

Further on we move on to the imposing Palace of Justice: the biggest in the world!

Then we reach the royal court quarter, where kings, dukes and princesses will be the protagonists of our stories. Also the royal palace we'll be waiting for us.

Finally, we will end our visit at the "Mont des Arts", the cradle of Brussels culture and the most beautiful viewpoint of the city.

How does it sound, are you joining us? Book now!

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Wallen Bar Eatery
MIMA
Café Georgette
The Original Free Tour of Brussels (Available in English)
shortDescription:
This 2.5-hour Brussels Free Tour will show you all the top attractions in the old city. Local experts will take you to must-see spots such as iconic Grand Place, the Mannekin Pis, and the birthplace of everyone’s favourite comic adventurer, Tintin. Join us as we explore the political capital of Europe the way Brussels was meant to be seen; by walking along ancient royal buildings, through the cobblestone streets, and up the hills to the museum quarter.

Your Brussels Free Tour starts in front of the tower of City Hall on Grand Place/Grote Markt and finishes by Mont des Arts. Navigating this trilingual city can be daunting, even for the most experienced traveler!

From the heart of trade to the centre of politics

Brussels today might be known as the political powerhouse of Europe, but it got its start as a trade capital. 

Despite being occupied by Germany in both World War I and II, the city remained relatively undamaged. After the war, Brussels underwent extensive modernisation and is now home of many international institutions, making it one of the most important cities in Europe. We lead you through the winding streets and discover the sites of the beginnings of the city over 1,500 years ago.

Brussels comic art scene

No other country has produced more comic artists than Belgium – Tintin, Spike and Suzy and the Smurfs are all created by Belgian artists. Get a brief insight into the history of comic art in Brussels and even see your favourite characters painted on the sides of buildings!
 
Highligths:

  • The tower of City Hall on Grand Place/Grote Markt
  • Marvel at the UNESCO World Heritage Sites, the Grand Place and Town Hall
  • Learn about the history of Brussels at the Maison du Roi
  • See the 217 year old Stock Exchange building
  • Window shop at Galeries Royales Saint-Hubert
  • Giggle at the Belgian humour of the Manneken Pis statue
  • Visit the La Monnaie, home to the National Opera of Belgium
  • See the oldest church in Brussels, Saint Nicholas’ Church
  • Find the library and Nation Archives found in the Mont des Arts
  • Discover Brussels’ comic art scene

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free tour nocturno por Bruselas. (Available in Spanish)
shortDescription:
Free tour nocturno por Bruselas
 What if you visit en el free nocturno por Bruselas?

 En nuestro free nocturno por Bruselas, iremos a descubrir el festival de luces "Bright Brussels". During this festival, que solo se realiza unos días al año, the capital of Europe presents unas rutas iluminadas con creaciones envolventes y poéticas de numerosos artistas (este año, el festival se realiza desde el 26 de octubre hasta el 11 de noviembre). Además, a program on OFF completes the festival with various actos de gran colorido.

 Desde el día 26 de noviembre hasta el 5 de enero, en Bruselas if it starts the fiesta de navidad y por supuesto, nuestro free nocturno por Bruselas, nos llevará a descubrir el mercado de navidad, one of the greatest of Bélgica.

Starting from 7 de noviembre hasta el 25 de noviembre, además de las fechas que van desde el 6 de enero hasta el 31 de March, iremos a ver, los cafés, las brasseries, los restaurantes y los bares de Bruselas. Conoceremos, el famous bar el Cercueil , with sus mesas en forma de ataúd, bar que fue fuente de inspiración de Leydi Gaga when visiting Bruselas ¿descubre por qué? También, veremos el bar más antiguo de la ciudad y caminaremos por los pintorescos impases.

 Descubriremos, el icónico bar La Fleur en Papier Doré , whence Rene Magritte , realized on primera exposición y Herge sus bocetos ..., Pasaremos por el bar Moeder Lambic en la plaza Fontainas, para saber cuáles son las nuevas creaciones en materia de cervezas Belgian . We will continue hasta el bar L'Archiduc, favorite of the Gestapo, during the Segunda Guerra Mundial en Bruselas. In the actuality, in the bar if you realize live concerts of jazz music . We will end our free night by Bruselas in the old city harbor in the bar on the street.

 In spring desde el primero de abril hasta finales de octubre, cuando los días se alargan hasta la noche, weldremos del centro histórico, para ir a conocer el the famous barrio de Ixelles y su icónica Place Flagey . Barrio de casas de lujos con dos bonitos estanques, the plaza is constantly observed for the escultura of the portugués más internacional Fernado Pessoa y es whence en esta época, if he lives the authentic noche en Bruselas. The Plaza holds números cafés, restantes and el bar más famous de todos, el Café Belga.

 In our free tour nocturno por Bruselas en Ixelles, pasaremos por the area de Matonge , famous for sus ofertas gastronómicas with productos africanos and the plaza Saint-Boniface , cosmopolitan barrio with sus bares de moda. Veremos the plaza Fernando Cocq and the casa de Maria Malibran . Observaremos, the Street Art that have realized the artistas locales of the barrio in the Chaussée d 'ixelles . Pasaremos by the famous estanques and by the famous Belgian Café in the Place Flagey. We will end our nocturna visit in the abadía de la Cambre. Además, muy seek de la abadía está el Parque de la Cambre y mucho más, ...

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: The Brussels Highlights Free Tour (Available in English)
shortDescription:
Follow us through the most historic streets and alleys in the center of Brussels and let us show you the city!

Heritage, history, culture, give you a great overview of the city. But we won’t forget to show you some more hidden places and to tell you some unusual anecdotes!

You will be able to find, perhaps…

  • The beautiful Brussels Grand Place
  •  The Royal Palace 
  •  Sainte-Catherine district 
  •  Saint-Géry; party place, but full of History!
  •  Manneken Pis
  •  The Palace of Justice and the Marolles district 
  •  The “Pitta Street“
  •  Galeries Royales Saint-Hubert; among the oldest covered galleries in Europe
  •   Mont des Arts
  •  …But also many small stories and anecdotes!


PRACTICAL INFO

Cost: Voluntary*
Duration: About 2 hours
Group max: 25 people
Meeting point :
In front of Hotel Amigo (next to Grand Place) rue de L' amigo
1000 Brussels

name: Free Tour Old Town of Brussels. (Available in Spanish)
shortDescription:
We can't tell you everything about the tour, but we'll try to make it look like it is: Irresistible!
Discover Brussels from the hand of architects and specialists in the city, and in a totally different way... The European city par excellence hides an architectural, historical and cultural legacy that you will not believe.
We will walk through the city focusing our attention, not only on the main monuments, but also on its history, customs, legends, and corners that not everyone knows.
In this visit, we like to show how the contemporary facet of the city has perfectly adapted to the historical heritage , making you see that the modern can have more value than we give it.
We are sure that we will all end up a little more in love with Brussels, if that is possible :)

What are we going to visit?
Here are some of the main stops we will make on our tour

  • Cathedral of Saint Michael and Saint Gudula. (meeting point)
  • Queen's Galleries.
  • Great square of Brussels.
  • Manneken Pis.
  • City walls.
  • Petit Sablon neighborhood.
  • Church of Notre Dame du Sablon
  • Courthouse.
  • Royal Square.
  • Royal Palace.
  • Mont des Arts. (Final point)


Comfortable shoes are recommended, the guides will provide a bottle of water to each participant free of charge.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Escape Game Hangover in Brussels
description:
The new escape game that runs on smartphone and challenge you in real life!
Bring technology, friends and beer together!

Escape Brussels will allow you to see Brussels in a new way, compete virtually with other teams. Spend 1h in the bars and 1.5h walking around, completing missions and challenges. Totally covid-safe, this is a private experience, you stay at all times with the people you book with and we won't add any random person to your team.

name: Aux Armes de Bruxelles - Brasserie bruxelloise historique
O Bifanas (Chez Sebastiao)
Virtual Room Bruxelles - 1ère expérience de réalité virtuelle en équipe
description:
Vous voyagerez aux limites de l'espace et du temps, dans une expérience inédite au cœur de Bruxelles, à quelques mètres à peine de la Grand Place.

Vivez le meilleur de la réalité virtuelle collaborative, dans une salle spécialement conçue et équipée des dernières nouveautés technologiques.

À vous de relever le défi pour partager d’intenses moments de complicité, mesurer votre réactivité, votre esprit de déduction et de coopération.

Et si l’avenir du monde était entre vos mains ?
Pour le savoir, constituez dès maintenant votre équipe et rejoignez l’aventure !

name: Wolf Sharing Food Market
KANAL - Centre Pompidou
Manneken Pis
The Foodmaker
The Brussels Card
description:
The Brussels Card is your entrance ticket to over 49 museums in Brussels. From chocolate to comic strips and Magritte to music, there is a museum to suit. Along with free entrance, you can also use your Brussels Card to enjoy discounts in selected shops and restaurants across the city.

Upgrade your experience and opt for the Brussels Card with public transportation! When buying the public transportation ticket in combination with the Brussels Card, you save the normal 5-euro cost of issuing the transportation ticket. Your Brussels Card with public transportation also provides you, during 24, 48 or 72 hours, unlimited and free access to the Brussels public transportation: all tramways, subways and buses operated by the STIB/MIVB (official transport company of the Brussels Capital Region).

name: Ricotta & Parmesan
Brussels Hard Rock Cafe Skip the Line 2- or 3- Course Meal
description: Skip the line at the Hard Rock Cafe in Brussels and head straight inside to dine on its classic American-style food! Choose from two different menus (either a 2-course or 3-course meal) and then sit back and eat, soaking up the atmosphere of Brussels, as well as seeing the rock ‘n’ roll memorabilia for which the Hard Rock Cafes are famous. See a lace outfit worn by Madonna, handwritten lyrics of Guns N’ Roses songs and more, while dining in the heart of Brussels.

name: Mont des Arts
Choco-Story: The Chocolate Museum in Brussels
description:
Dive into the world of chocolate!

By visiting Choco-Story Brussels, you will learn how first the Mayas, then the Aztecs, grew cocoa trees, how the cocoa bean conquered Europe and how cocoa is made into chocolate.

name: Chocolate Workshop
Musée des brasseurs belges
Café Mort Subite
Free Tour Art Nouveau and Victor Horta (Brussels) (Available in English, Spanish, French)
description:
ART NOUVEAU AND VICTOR HORTA TOUR Art Nouveau Brussels guided tour: birth and evolution of this architectural style through its most beautiful achievements.​

This is a guided tour of Art Nouveau architecture in Brussels. Learn about the birth and evolution of this architectural style through its buildings and discover the most beautiful achievements of Art nouveau architecture in Brussels.​
The 3-hour guided tour begins at the “Grand-Place” with a visit to the “Old England House” .
Then take the tram to the "Bailli" neighborhood in the "Ixelles" district. Bourgeois-bohemian residential neighborhood where we find one of the largest and most important concentration of Art Nouveau style houses in Brussels.
The visit ends in front of the house of Maestro Victor Horta (now converted into the Horta Museum).

Itinerary:
Old House England (Music Instrument Museum) Tassel Hotel, built by Victor Horta in 1893-1894 Van Rysselberghe House, built by Ocatave Van Rysselberghe in 1912 Otlet Hotel, built by Ocatave Van Rysselberghe and Henry van de Velde from 1894-1898 Goblet Hotel d'Alviella, built by Ocatave Van Rysselberghe in 1882 Ciamberlani hotel, built by Paul Hankar in 1897 The house of the painter René Janssens, built by Paul Hankar in 1898 Architect Armand Van Waesberghe The Beukman house, built by Albert Roosenboom in 1900 The private house by the architect Paul Hankar Victor Horta Museum … ​​

PRACTICAL INFORMATION:
​Price: Free Payment ​
Meeting point: The Grand-Place of Brussels in front of the City Hall.​
Duration: Around 3h​
Transportation (1 tram ticket)​
Does not include: The entrance to the Horta museum, food or drink or the tram ticket back to the historic center

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Scheltema
Free Tour "Unusual and alternative Brussels the Lower Town" (Available in English, Spanish, French)
description:
Brussels: "The Lower City is unusual and alternative"
In the company of our professional guides, come every day to enjoy an interesting visit to the historic center of Brussels.

We will be able to offer you Brussels under the themes: "Unusual and alternative the Lower City" and you will be able to fully explore the birth and historical evolution of the city. Indeed, Brussels is located in a territory with different altitudes that have witnessed and influenced throughout its history.

Free tour- Lower town: "Brussels the popular"

  • The Grand-Place (Brussels main square)
  • The monument to Éverard t'Serclaes located on Charles Buls street
  • The Manneken Piss
  • The Notre-Dame de Bon Secours church
  • Anspach Boulevard
  • la senne
  • Saint-Géry islet
  • Reconstruction of the old arm of the Senne
  • The Halles Saint-Géry
  • The Zinneke Pee
  • Sainte-Catherine Square and its church
  • the black tower
  • The old beguinage and the Saint-Jean-Baptiste church
  • Brouckere Square
  • The Coin Square
  • The Royal Galleries
  • Charles Bulls Square

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: The unknown and alternative Free Walking Tour of Brussels (Available in Spanish)
description:
ENTER THE MOST UNKNOWN AND ALTERNATIVE BRUSSELS! This tour will take you through the Brussels that goes unnoticed by tourists. The complement to our tour of the Center of Brussels (Every day at 12:00 and at 4:00 p.m.) Brussels is known for its monuments. However, there is much more, if you already know the city center, with this guided tour you will have the opportunity to discover the least known parts and stories of the city and its people: alleys, meeting points for political dissidents and artists, Urban art, an old port, an exclusively female community, immigration and much more. THE OLD BRUSSELS AND THE UNDERGROUND BRUSSELS Our visit will allow us to address the past Brussels and the current Brussels, its evolutions and its problems. In order to reflect on the city and reach a more complete compression. Of course, to also let us know the most alternative and underground Brussels: The places where art comes alive and where the party takes place. The hidden and secret Brussels tour is the best option to know what lies behind the Manneken Pis.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Cathédrale Saints-Michel-et-Gudule de Bruxelles
Brussels Waffle Workshop
description:
During this workshop, you’ll prepare traditional Belgian waffle dough, cook it, and then decorate your waffles with cream, chocolate, and seasonal fruits. No previous cooking experience is necessary, and kids are warmly welcome.

After a short introduction, we’ll go through the recipe, split into teams, and start cooking. We provide everything: all ingredients, cooking gear, waffle irons, a demonstration, and assistance.

Feel free to make the craziest topping combinations and take pictures! Every participant will receive a complimentary drink to enjoy with his/her waffles.

If you eat over 9 waffles during the workshop, you will become our new champion!! The record has been standing for a while and we are looking for someone to beat it!!!

name: Brussels Fun and Interactive Beer Tasting Experience
description: Interactive and fun beer tasting in our workshop (and old bar) in downtown Brussels. We will cover the basics of brewing, the different types of beers, what makes the Belgian beers different and we will invite you to taste 5 very unique Belgian brews!

name: Grand place
Les Galeries Royales Saint-Hubert
Free Tour of the authentic historical center of Brussels (Available in English, Spanish, French)
description:
Free Tour in the authentic center of Brussels.
Our guides are waiting for you every day to enjoy an interesting visit in the authentic historical center of Brussels, the capital of Europe. Discover all the details about the comic, chocolate, beer and Belgian gastronomy.

The Guided Tour starts at 10:30 – Lower Town – Brussels the authentic Belgian City. We will see on our tour:

  • The Grand-Place (Brussels main square).
  • The Manneken Pis .
  • We will visit the lively area of ​​Saint-Jacques de Compostela with its beautiful cafes and its houses made of red bricks
  • The Church of Our Lady of Good Help.
  • The Enredo murals by Frank Pé, The Carin Mural with Victor Sackvill e, The Ric Hochet mural, The Nero mural by Marc Sleen.
  • Also, Anspach Boulevard .
  • The river Senne .
  • The island of Saint-Géry and the reconstruction of the old branch of the Senne river.
  • Also, the Saint-Géry market area; which is currently the heart of the nightlife in the center of the city.
  • The Zinneke Pis .
  • Santa Catalina square with its church.
  • The Black Tower .
  • The old beguinary and the church of San Juan Bautista .
  • De Brouckere square .
  • The Plaza de la Moneda.
  • The Jeanneke piss and the Café delirium tremens.
  • We will continue through the San Huberto royal galleries
  • We will finish on Charles Buls square.


Likewise, our guide will give you all the information about: The museums and their collections, The best bars and beers, Where to shop for artisan chocolates at the best prices.​ Our guide will answer all the questions you may have: Restaurants, Attractions, Nightlife, Public Transportation, etc.

It includes:
-Professional guide in Spanish.
-Free tasting of the best Belgian chocolates. ( If the Covid 19 regulations allow it)

 Does not include: -Payment to the guide (voluntary payment).

Terms and Conditions Modalities of participation:
-In order to guarantee your participation in the visit, we recommend that you reserve your place as soon as possible.

-Participation in the Free Tour of Brussels is completely voluntary.

-We ask that you show up at the meeting point at least 10 minutes before the scheduled start time to start the visit on time and comply with the program.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Mysteries and Legends Free Walking Tour of Brussels (Available in Spanish)
description:
We will tell you what no one dares to say, the true meanings and origins that is hidden behind the most emblematic buildings of the Grand Square in Brussels. We will meet at 4:00 pm at the Grand Place in Brussels, the most emblematic place in the city, to begin a walking tour of the old town. This will be the ideal scenario as the starting point of the tour, since numerous enigmas are hidden in the elegant buildings of the square. To unveil them, we will look at the golden facades, where we will find esoteric symbols and related to alchemy. In fact, the legend tells that the Philosopher's Stone was invented here. Will it be true? In addition, we will pose a challenge: will you be able to guess the missing sign of the zodiac in an important building in the historic center? Let's see who is the first to find out! The tour will also take us through the streets surrounding the Grand Place. In them we will know the fascinating Masonic past of the Belgian capital. It will surprise you! We will finish the free tour of Brussels in Les Halles de Saint-Géry, around 6:00 p.m.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free Tour The wonders of Brussels + Tasting of 🧇 and 🍫 (Available in Spanish)
description:
On this tour we will visit very interesting points of this beautiful city, where celebrities such as Victor Hugo (Les Miserables 1862), Karl Marx (Communist Manifesto), Hergé (The Adventures of Tintin) have lived.
We will walk through emblematic points of the capital of the European Union , enveloping ourselves in the aroma of its streets that smell of: wafels (waffles: small tasting) frietjes (crisps), pralines (chocolates), chocolates (small tasting), bieren (beers )!!!
I will talk about history, legends, gastronomy and other curiosities.
We will take photos in some of the instagrammable points of Brussels.
You are going to fall in love with the Grand Place(Grote Markt)
We will see Tintin Mural
Manneken Pis
Grand Sablon and Petit Sablon

name: FREE TOUR through BRUSSELS ⭐ THE ESSENTIAL ⭐ (Available in English, Spanish)
description:
Mundistour is a company made up of professional guides, whose purpose is to be able to show travelers who want to know Belgium the most important and monumental places, but also those secrets and details that make each city unique.
In the historic Brussels tour we will take a tour of the lower part of the city , where we can discover many of the most important places in the city. We will begin our tour in the most important and beautiful square in the city , the Grand Plaçe, we will see the symbol of Brussels, the Manneken Pis , we will be able to discover the place where the country's independence began, we will understand why the world of comics is so important In Belgium, we will visit the city's cathedral and we will finish our tour in one of the most beautiful points of Brussels , the Mount of Arts , with its panoramic view.

In addition to seeing emblematic places and talking about the history of the country, we will also discover its gastronomic secrets , such as chocolate , French fries or its mythical beer.
Route:

  • Grand Place
  • Tintin mural
  • Manneken Pis
  • Brussels Stock Exchange

  • San Hubert Galleries

name: Brussels Night Free Tour (Available in Spanish)
description:
Brussels at night!
We invite you to join us on a special tour of the historic center of the city of Brussels. In this tour we will enjoy the historical monuments of the city center once the night falls little by little and we will be able to enjoy them from another point of view.
In addition, this tour will have a cultural part , which when enjoyed in the afternoon / evening, has a unique flavor since it allows you to see the city in all its splendor.

The tour, which will begin at the Grand Plaçe, will first allow us to see the illuminated Royal Galleries and, if we are lucky, with a show. From there, we will go to an alley where one of the most special taverns in the city is still preserved, which is the Puppet Theater. And very close to this point, we will finally discover one of the places that visitors to the city ask the most about, the Delirium Tremens, and, although many people do not know it, the Jeanneken Pis.
On our tour we will also see one of the oldest churches in the city, the Church of Saint Nicholas, or another very special church such as the Church of Notre Dame de Bon Secours. And, in addition to all this most historic part, we will see the gay neighborhood and, above all, murals, many of them among the most beautiful in the city.
And, in a tour of these characteristics, in which history, art and culture are going to be combined, a visit to the area where life makes sense at night could not be missed . We will go to the old port of the city, to a memory of the first city wall or to see the Zinnikin Pis, another of the symbols of the city.
We will end our visit in one of the meeting points of the city and old medieval market, Halles de Saint Gery, where you can now take the opportunity to stay for dinner or have one of the wonderful Belgian beers. And this will be possible, because we will not forget to talk about one of the most important delicacies in the city and where to consume it.

Our tour:

  • Royal Galleries
  • Puppet Theater·
  • Delirium tremens
  • Jeanneke Pis
  • impasse
  • Church of Saint Nicholas
  • gay neighborhood
  • Church of Notre Dame de Bon Secours
  • Place des Fontaines
  • Church of Saint Catherine
  • black tower
  • old city port
  • Zinneke Pis
  • San GerY market

name: Atomium & European Quatier Free Walking Tour of Brussels (Available in Spanish)
description:
Departure from the Grand Place, in the company of our guide at 10:30, to the Central Station, here we will take the metro to the Merode station, where the famous Tervuren Avenue is located, from there we will walk to the Cinquantenaire Park, with its famous arcades built at the request of King Leopold II. The park also houses the Art and History museums, the Automobile Museum, the Aviation Museum and the Navy Museum. We continue to the heart of Europe, the roundabout of Robert Schuman (considered one of the parents of the European Union), here are two of the main organs of the European Union; the Berlaymont, headquarters of the European Commission and the Justus Lipsius (current European Council) with its new annex, the Europa building "An egg of space", with 3,750 windows that reflect the diversity of Europe, in the latter meet the Heads of State of the European Union to hold the famous European summits and meetings of EU ministers. We leave this emblematic area to visit Leopoldo Park, a former Brussels zoo. In this park is currently the European History Museum, in a recently restored building, which was built by philanthropist Eastman Kodak, who invented the film for photos and founded several dental institutes for poor children in some European cities. Also in this park is the Ernest Solvay building, today an elementary school where the medallions of the engineers who worked for him are located. We continue our walk through the buildings of the European Institutions such as the Economic, Regional and Social Committees of the Union and the "European Parliament". The latter has two locations, one in Brussels and the second in Strasbourg. (The Brussels building is an unquestionably architectural beauty), known as the whim of God. Here we will have a pause time. Then, we will go by subway to the most visited Atomium monument in Brussels, located on the esplanade of Heysel, which houses the Belgian pavilions of the Universal Exhibitions of the years 1935 and 1958. This area also houses the Mini Europa park and the Heysel National Stadium. In this last stage, we conclude our tour and give the necessary recommendations to move around Brussels or so that our clients can visit the Mini Europa park, the Heysel Stadium or simply stroll through the Laeken park, formerly "Royal Domain of Laeken ", which was the residence of the favorite daughter of Empress Maria Teresa of Austria and even of Napoleon, today permanent residence of the Kings of Belgium. Please keep in mind! At the end of April and beginning of May, the Royal Palace permanent residence of the Kings of Belgium opens its doors to visit the famous royal greenhouse. Do not forget to visit it. PROGRAM Central Station, Metro Merode, with Tervuren Avenue and the Cinquantenaire Park with its famous arcades, Art and history museums, the automobile museum, the Aviation museum and the Navy museum, The emblematic roundabout of Robert Schuman (considered one of the parents of the European Union), where the main organs of the European Union are located, Leopoldo Park, Ernest Solvay building, The buildings of the economic, regional and social committees of the European Union, The "European Parliament", The Atomium and the former Royal domain of Laeken, the Mini Europa park and the Heysel Stadium. On your own you can visit the Japanese Tower and the China Pavilion in Laeken. Attention if you visit Brussels in the dates of late April and early May, the Royal Palace of Laeken opens its doors to visit the famous greenhouses, one of the many whims of the second king of Belgium, Leopold II. You can take the best pictures of exotic and floral plants. PRACTICAL INFORMATION Price: Voluntary payment. Bravo Discovery puts at your disposal our best guides in Brussels. It is you who values ​​the quality of our services and the guide. At the end of the visit, you pay what you think is right to our guide. When: Every Tuesday and Thursday Departure time: 10:30 am Meeting point: The Grand Place of Brussels in front of the Town Hall. Duration: About 4 hours Language: Spanish Includes: Professional guide in Spanish Discount to visit the Atomium and Mini Europa Park Not included: Transportation by subway (please go to the tour with the subway tickets already purchased. We recommend you buy a one-day fare ticket for this tour).

name: Brussels Classic Free Walking Tour with Richi (Available in English, Spanish)
description:
The visit starts near the beautiful “Grand Place” or “Grote Markt” of Brussels, it’s the central square of the City of Brussels.
All over the world, it is known for its decorative and aesthetic wealth.

The Grand Place is surrounded by guild houses, the City Hall, and the Maison du Roi. The Grand-Place is considered one of the most beautiful places in the world. The Grand-Place of Brussels was registered on the World Heritage List of UNESCO in 1998.


Then, we will explore the surrounding streets to discover street art, the “great” Manneken Pis (or Peeing Boy), and the Galleries of St. Hubert, the first shopping arcade in the world.

I will explain the Cathedral outside/inside. 

From there, we will go up to the Sablon quarter known for its great variety of art galleries and the Marolles quarter, the rebellious quarter of Brussels.

Finally, we will make our way to the Royal Court quarter, located in the upper part of Brussels, from where we will have a view of the city from the Mont des Arts.

name: Free Tour of the Christmas Markets in Brussels (Available in )
description:
We will meet at the Grand-Place, with our guide, to introduce ourselves to the fabulous world of Christmas, because in December the city of Brussels has a unique atmosphere that immerses us in the world of Christmas.

On our tour, we will know where the tradition of the nativity comes from, the mangers, the wise men and why the Christmas tree must be a pine tree. What is the relationship that pine trees have with Christmas?

We will also discover the legend of Saint Nikolas and his relationship with Coca-Cola. Keep in mind that it is in Brussels, where the largest Christmas market in Belgium takes place, they; Belgians call it “les Plaisirs d'hiver”. This great festival begins at the end of November and lasts the entire month of December until the beginning of January. The city is decorated with lights and Christmas "chalets" in places full of stories and legends. The people of Brussels usually come with friends or family to taste the typical seasonal products or simply to find the much sought after gifts for Saint Nicholas, Christmas or for the arrival of the Three Wise Men. After attending the spectacular light and sound show, we will go to see the Church of Saint Nicholas and discover the passion of Belgians for this famous saint.

We will continue to the emblematic square of San Caterina, to learn about the typical Christmas gastronomy that Belgians consume, such as: cougnou, the Stoemp aux chicons & lardons dish, Les peket and Tartiflette..., And why not? we stop for a mulled wine with our local guide?

We will also see approximately more than 250 chalets that are spread throughout the capital, creating a very typical northern European festive atmosphere. Our tour ends at the Place de la Monnaie (patinoire) where Napoleon built himself a theater to entertain himself in Brussels. Here you can enjoy the impressive ice skating rink that is set up every year during the Christmas holidays.

Please, before showing up for the visit, Free Tour of the Christmas Market and the Winter Delights of Brussels, you must make your bracelet or your bracelet.

Where to get the bracelets or bracelets to enter the Christmas market in Brussels?

Tourists and visitors will have to obtain a new bracelet or bracelet every day by going through one of the collection points. At the entrance of tourist information in the Grand-Place , there is an information point and for obtaining the bracelet or bracelet "This bracelet or bracelet can be obtained in a dozen points along the route after checking the QR code that indicates that the Ticket Covid insurance is valid, accompanied by an identity document". In addition to the bracelet or bracelet, the use of a mask will be mandatory for everyone over 10 years of age throughout the route of the Christmas Market and the Winter Pleasures of Brussels and in the streets that connect the different places of the event.

description:
Blurb
Why is Belgium split into two regions? Where and when was Brussels founded? What does "Brussels" mean? Where did the money to build the Grand Place come from? Why is Belgian chocolate and beer so good? You will find answers to these and many more questions by exploring Brussels on my tour.

name: Free Tour Imperial Brussels (Available in )
description:
DISCOVER THE MOST IMPERIAL BRUSSELS!

On this two-hour tour you will be able to discover the most imperial and aristocratic part of the city. Brussels is not only the Grand Plaçe , the Manneken Pis or its Cathedral , but much more. We encourage you to come and discover with us buildings and emblematic places of the city.
On this tour we will discover imposing monuments, such as the Royal Palace, the Royal Square or the Plaza del Trono . We will walk through the most luxurious street in the city, the Golden Toison , where all the luxury shops in the city are located.
And from the most luxurious area, we will enter the neighborhood of the bourgeoisie of the city: the Sablon . There we can discover the most beautiful Brabantine Gothic church in the city, the Church of Our Lady , marvel at the Petit Sablon , a romantic park from the 18th century or observe the houses so characteristic of the gentry.

 In our final part of the tour, we will see several monuments that will leave us speechless. In the first place, we will be able to see the Great Synagogue, the main synagogue in Europe, and, from there, we will go to Poelaert Square , where the largest civil building built in the 19th century is located, the Palace of Justice. And to say goodbye, we will do so by observing a panoramic view of the city from that same square, where you can see the Atomium.
Our tour:

  • Central Gare
  • Clock of the Mount of Arts
  • Royal Square
  • Museum of Fine Arts
  • Royal Palace
  • Coudenberg Palace Ruins
  • Palace of the Academies
  • Throne Square
  • Golden Fleece
  • Palace of the Count d'Egemont
  • Petit Sablon

  • courthouse

name: Free tour Brussels European Quarter (Available in English, Spanish)
description:
Discover with us the history and all the secrets of the EU in its capital.
Mundistour invites you to join an essential tour to learn about the history, operation, and most emblematic buildings of the European Union . And what better way to do it than in the capital of this organization.

Brussels, in addition to the capital of Belgium, is also the unofficial capital of the EU and where more buildings dedicated to this body are found. What's more, Brussels has a neighborhood in the center of the city called ¨ the European quarter ¨, and it is not by chance, but because everything there revolves around the organization.

Our tour will start at the central train station and we will head first to the Ravenstein Galleries , hundreds of Belgians cross them daily to go to their government work. Right in front we find the Royal Park , which in addition to being the lungs of the city, divides the political center in two ; on one side, the Belgian power and on the other the European .

We will begin to see embassies and also, if we look at the buildings, dozens of lobbies that exert their influence in this city. We will quickly arrive at one of the most symbolic buildings of the EU, the European Parliament , place of popular representation of the Union. Behind it is the Parque de Leopoldo and the Museum of the History of Europe .

In the final part of our tour we will see buildings as important as the European Commission , the European Council or the Palacio de la Prensa . We will end our tour in another of the impressive places in Brussels: the Fiftieth Anniversary Park and its monument dedicated to the country's independence.

Dare to discover the ins and outs of one of the most important organisms in the world with us.
What will we see?:

  • Brussels Central Station
  • Ravenstein Galleries
  • royal park
  • Embassy and lobbies area
  • meeus park
  • European Parliament
  • European History Museum
  • Leopold's Park
  • Schuman Roundabout
  • Berlaymont
  • Council of the EU
  • press palace
  • fiftieth anniversary park
  • Mosque
  • fiftieth anniversary arc
